sentences: Täna tuli mees ja seistas minu ette järjekorras.
context: The word 'seisan' is the 1st person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'seista', which means 'to stand'. When used with 'järjekorra' (line/queue), it specifically means to stand in a line or wait in queue. It's commonly used when joining a line at shops, offices, or any situation where people need to wait their turn in an orderly fashion.
